title: Ever since the new patch I get "Update Failed" as it tries to patch
body:
I made a ticket and riot is taking their sweet time getting back to me. So I am reaching out here for help.

What have I done so far?
1. Tried to Play the game in admin mode 
2. Hextech repair tool (Every option including a full clean install)
3. Even disabled my firewall temporarily while I tried logging in. 

All I have tried seems to not effect this issue. In total I have (using the hextech tool) uninstalled and redownloaded the game three times this morning. 

Has anyone had this issue and fixed it in the past? Please help. Thank you in advance.

-Zenkage

replies.body: Is this happening on the legacy or updated client?  When exactly are you getting the error message, for example is it at a specific %?  Are you using an antivirus, and which one if so?  This issue could be with your permissions setting or connection, so a reinstall wouldn't really fix it.  If you have any other info or even screenshots let me know, so I can get a better idea of your specific case.  Let me know!

Before this error started happening I had the updated client. I had a chance to change and got the error with the new client so I tried the old client. Both have the same message "update failed" click OK then asks to restart this repeats endlessly and although it said I finished the download to 100% I can see inbetween the restart button box popping up and going away over and over the download reading 33%. 
The ani virus I use is webroot I tried disabling it and this made zero difference. I have a ticket up with my logs attached if that helps also

This is great, thanks for your information!  It sounds like you might have an unstable connection in this case that's missing pieces of your update and trying to backtrack.  If you're getting cut off or failing to catch up then you'll likely see that error.  For this case, go over each step of the [connection issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) guide to make sure you're getting through.  Let me know if you have any questions!

After looking through the forums their is a reacurring theme with this issue. Webroot. I tried not only disabling it but completely turning it off and now the error is not popping up. and I was able to log in. Seems fixed
Great to hear it.  I did notice your info on Webroot, but it seemed that you were passed that since you didn't receive a specific alert from the antivirus.  Thanks for the heads up on this!
